title.narrative: Guiding National Park protection efforts via aerial surveillance

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to provide support to the Gabonese National Parks Agency (ANPN) and the Forestry Department through the provision of information on human activities gathered from aerial surveys. This will be accomplished by a set of flight plans to cover bais, savannahs, marshes, park limits, and key access routes. All flights will result in GPS and high resolution geo-referenced photographs from which an observation report will be generated the same day and provided to the relevant authority in order to improve law enforcement capacity and increase protection of Gabon’s National Parks. Activities include: 1) Quarterly aerial surveillance of national parks' savannahs ands swamps, 2) Twice yearly aerial surveys of all known bais, 3) Annual surveillance flights of boundaries of each park, and 4) Standardized data collection methods and reporting for adaptive management.

description.narrative: Gabon is an active contributor to conflict resolution and regional security efforts in the Central African region, hosting, and acting as a driving force behind the Economic Community of Central African States, which is establishing a regional standby peacekeeping brigade under the auspices of the African Union's Africa Standby Force. U.S. security assistance to Gabon is aimed at professionalizing the small armed forces (fewer than 8,000 armed service members) by providing training, which will create a force able to operate effectively in regional peacekeeping and maritime security efforts. Gabon has roughly 500 troops participating in U.N peacekeeping efforts in the Central African Republic.
